intro: Psilotrichopsis curtisii var. curtisii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf psilotrichopsis, is a rare and primitive vascular plant belonging to the family Psilotaceae. It is characterized by its simple, dichotomously branched stems and small, scale-like leaves. The plant exhibits a unique reproductive structure known as a synangium, which contains spores. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
